reviewText:
I tried this out for a little bit, after having watched someone else play it, who got incredibly sick and tired of it after a couple of hours, I, on the other hand, decided to give it another chance, as it looked incredibly promising, I like the concept a lot.

Here's what made me quit though, I was playing along, through the tutorial and all, and the very moment I got out into the real game, with just the free starter gear, I was swarmed by the same group of people who constantly banished things onto me, well that's fine, I can handle myself right? Well apparently not, every time I did the same to them, I watched them kill everything within a few seconds, so it's my gear that might be the problem, I then look through the store, and since I'm already getting tired of getting beat down, and have no intention of playing, I decided to get the best gear my little pathetic starter pile of souls would get me, and sure enough, I started one-hitting everything and those guys who were laughing at me, then decided to find the next completely free player in the worst, and possibly broken gear.
Well that's nice, since people don't mess with me now, maybe I can actually try play the game, right? No. I started noticing how quickly the gear actually got worn down, it's not TOO bad if you're constantly on top of it, but what kind of normal person enjoys playing a game where they get more anxiety about when their gear breaks, than if they're going to get ambushed by a person who wants to mess with you? I find that a little ridiculous.
Also, the prices of such are insane, I went onto the store to see how much cash I would actually have to spend, per hour, to continue playing with the best gear for the level cap, and also repairing it and such, and it can actually be pretty hefty of a price to just run around in a rather unpolished game, which is so mindnumbingly dull, both about graphics and control.
About the graphics, it really bothers me that the developers seem to keep forgetting about the scaling of the world around me, regular farming tools are the size of what I would expect a 6-ox driven siege machine, grass tickles my knees and most of the trees are just way too tall compared to how large humans actually are, I DO know some trees can grow amazingly tall, but I would like to see some variation.
Animation is too flat and lifeless, I can't go in depth more than that, there's no charm, no atmosphere, nothing, it lacks soul.

It bothers me that the one thing that seems to be the most finished, is the cash store at this point in time, I have beta tested many games that ended up going that route, and every time a game did, it quickly became a cash grabbing monstrosity which then slowly died off as it scared people away. I have witnessed many of my old favorites getting bought up by very large corporations too, altering the stores, making everything a tad more predatory as the updates slowly roll in, seeing it bleed out the exact same way.

I'm not paying for this, and obviously it makes a huge difference if you do, so I won't play.

reviewText:
So, Ascend: Han of Kul...What can i say?

Oh yes, so the game is great in many ways for example, the combat is really fun with combo's and the weapons you can buy/find changes the battles somewhat since they are not all the same like a mace is slow and hard hitting and has a different combo set whilst a small sword has a fast like INCREDIBLY fast swing speed but less damage.

''Sadly'' some things are a little bad in this game like the graphics are quite meh-ish but with all these great features i wouldn't really care as much as i do in other games, then we have the fact that it's ofcourse F2P so there has to be some kind of paying aspect, which there is and that is buying souls which is the ingame currency but it's not as bad as you think i mean yeah sure it's still buying currency but the souls are really easy to get once you've gotten a hang of the combat with all the combo's so i would NOT say this game is a P2W because well, it's not a P2W,  also the sad thing right now is that the dungeons are very lackluster since they have usually no bosses except for maybe one that is easy to defeat once he's attacked 1-3 times since you then know what he does and when and the whole dungeon is usually the same kind of room 3 times in a row, after playing for 4 hours i've seen 4 different kind of dungeons with the exact same mobs and setup with the rooms, but i can forgive them for that since it's early beta and it was just released on Steam atleast.

The cooler features we have are the Crusade/God features and the ENDLESS DUNGEEEEOOOOOOON! so, the crusade/god thing is basiaclly that as soon as you start the game you make a Caos and then you get to choose from 3 god, Light, Dark and Void (I won't go in to detail as much on what they do for you but i will try and cover some) so when you choose one of these you get a starting buff and then a spell which is attuned to the god you chose so Light is lightning, Void is ice and Dark is fire,
Now a REALLY cool thing is that when you start the game for real you are meant to capture villages/shrines and this is basiaclly what the game is only about right now so hopefully they'll add more things but when you capture a village/shrine that point is worth something to your whole Crusade (Crusade is which god you chose) so lets say you capture a village, then that village will go to your Crusade points which is how you see which Crusade is currently in the lead, if one faction capture one point enough then that point will belong to the entire Crusade and then it has to be taken over by the other Crusades we also have weekly challenges for all the Crusades which consists of killing things or capturing things, at the end of the week the winner of the challenge will be revealed and they get a buff and then here comes the cool part, if you get enough points yourself for your Crusade you will be put on a throne/pedestal in the Sanctum and all of the players will be able to see your character and think ''hmm, that guy must be the BEST player ever..'' oh and yeah the ENDLESS DUNGEOOOOOOOOOON kinda speaks for itself, it's just an endless dungeon that gives more and more rewards for each floor oh and this is quite important, everytime you get enough levels you have the chance to ascend, when you ascend you get to make a choice of one item (unless you buy more slots with souls) to keep for all your characters, now be wary because when you ascend you lose that character and all items except for the ones you save but you get to make a choice of which god you want to invest deeper into, that'll give you a buff that has something to do with the god you chose so for example, Dark gets curses which summons mobs that attack other players, so when you've chosen a god you then get to make a new character that inherits a couple of levels, some of the health and then the items you chose and vóila! you've been reborn!

So final thought is this for me: Game is great, get's boring if you play it too long since it has just come out to beta and there is not a lot of content, graphics are meh-ish but that doesn't really matter to be honest, would never call this a P2W since you can easily get souls yourself if you're good enough at the game, so all and all i love this game, download it and have fun cause i sure as hell have!

AND FOR HEAVENS SAKE, HELP US LIGHT-BROTHERS, WE NEED HELP!

reviewText:
I was pretty hyped up about this game because of the fact that this is primarily a first-person game.
However, hours into playing (two, to be exact) showed me how unbalanced it is.

Sure, you receive a nice amount of souls (in-game currency), and you can use them to build your character. If you don't, the game gets harder, but not *that* much. I, for an instance, got to level 8 with no problems while using up 5k souls worth of armor and weaponry.
Neutral point: it is hard to get that amount of souls back. Impossible? No. Hard.
Positive points:
- Nice graphics.
- Nice RPG-like system. (Weaponry, Armors, etc)
Negative points:
- The combat system is bad. There are big" monsters you have to face sometimes
date: and because they have (much) more health than you do
recommended: and inflict (much) more damage than your puny bone-sword does
hoursPlayed: the immediate strategy would be to wait for it to swing it's gigantic club
voteText: then get behind
helpfulPercent: strike as many times as you can
votesHelpful: then sprint to the other side
votesTotal: before he has the chance to strike again. Don't even try. If you do
votesFunny: chances are your sprint will throw you *towards* him.  Even if you somehow manage to escape his range
commentsCount:
... he will still hit you. Bugs FTW.
- The music is colossaly repetitive.
-  UI is confusing.
- Controls are confusing.
- A bug happens when you try to load the game for the first time: It minimizes and enters window mode. Then
column16: when you try to change to "fullscreen mode"... it minimizes again
column17: and reenters window mode.\n\nAn overall nice concept
column18: and a nice RPG-system... but that needs a lot of sandpapering."

reviewText:
**Light Spoilers**
Eat people off your back. Desecrate altars. Harvest the souls of the unborn. No, really.

This is a fun game, even if it's still in early beta. I'm even considering spending money on it, even if it's through microtransactions, which I've always loathed. The game has a lot of potential, and I'd like to see it grow. You can buy as little as $3 worth of in-game money. This game is well-worth $3 (and more).

I'd really like to see a little more depth to the combat, when the finished product comes out, but the combos you do have work well, and it feels very smooth. Adding different factions of humans to the mix, and the way they're integrated into combat is really cool.

One thing I like about this game is that it's fresh in a lot of ways. Give it a shot, for sure.

reviewText:
Lags like flying carps -- actually, the carps don't lag, but if they did, the game would lag worse.
I'm more than sure that the game SHOULD be able to run on this computer, and pretty well, but, sadly, I coudn't even get through the character creation in under 5 minutes like I should have because of its simplicity.

I wish I could say I loved the character creation, but it was simple in a way that character creators were not meant to be. Anything appealing (even hair) can't be used unless you buy it with souls". The game lagged worse than my flying carps (5.2 carpawatts more to be exact) all throughout the character creation.

Pros and Cons (Sorry
recommended:
I know this is a bit cliche for steam reviewers):
+ It's free - you can have all the lag you want FOR FREE!!!
+ It looked really nice - especially when I paused the game and stood still.
+ The concept of the game is good - I've never played a game that involved screaming at your computer before.
+ Your character is a megagiant monster dude - you'll love playing with him!
+ This game will make your computer lag in a way you never thought possible (settings can't save you now)
+ You probably won't make it through the intro - I almost selected my god. How far can you get?
+ It will be a challenge to have fun while multitasking with this game and something else. You may even get the family involved with the fun of screaming at the game and trying to get it to work while you finish watching your Justice League cartoons.

reviewText:
القرآن)، ولا تتم الصلاة (وعبادات أخرى) في الإسلام إلا بإتقان بعض العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير من أهم الأعمال الدينية والفكرية اليهودية في العصور الوسطى. وأثّر انتشار الإسلام، وتأسيسه دولاً، في ارتفاع مكانة اللغة العربية، وأصبحت لغة السياسة والعلم والأدب لقرون طويلة في الأراضي التي حكمها المسلمون، وأثرت العربية تأثيراً مباشراً أو غير مباشر على كثير من اللغات الأخرى في العالم الإسلامي، كالتركية والفارسية والأمازيغية والكردية والأردوية والماليزية والإندونيسية والألبانية وبعض اللغات الإفريقية الأخرى مثل الهاوسا والسواحيلية والتجرية والأمهرية و الصومالية، وبعض اللغات الأوروبية وخاصةً المتوسطية كالإسبانية والبرتغالية والمالطية والصقلية، كما أنها تُدرَّس بشكل رسمي أو غير رسمي في الدول الإسلامية والدول الإفريقية المحاذية للوطن العربي.
العربية لغة رسمية في كل دول الوطن العربي إضافة إلى كونها لغة رسمية في تشاد وإريتريا وإسرائيل. وهي إحدى اللغات الرسمية الست في منظمة الأمم المتحدة، ويُحتفل باليوم العالمي للغة العربية في يسمبركذكراعتماد العربية بين لغات العمل في الأمم المد
واللغة العربية من أغزر اللغات من حيث المادة اللغوية، فعلى سبيل المثال يحوي معجم لسان العرب لابن منظور من القرن الثالث عشر أكثر من ألف مادة، بينما في اللغة الإنجليزية فإن قاموس صموئيل جونسون وهو من أوائل من وضع قاموساً إنجليزياً من القرن الثامن عشر يحتوي على ألف كلم
تحتوي العربية على حرفاً مكتوباً. ويرى بعض اللغويين أنه يجب إضافة حرف الهمزة إلى حروف العربية، ليصبح عدد الحرو تُكتب العربية من اليمين إلى اليسار - ومثلها اللغة الفارسية والعبرية وعلى عكس الكثير من اللغات العالمية - ومن أعلى الصفحة إلى أسفلها.
العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير

reviewText: This is a over the top gore game in a cartonish universe that is actually very very dark fantasy. The notion that the character desing is sorta playfull and bulky anime type and that the gore and violence is explicit to the max- sort of gives a mix feeling about this game -which isnt good. The character desing and the levels are to say the least revoltingly grotesque and the level of blood on gore displayed mixed with over the top demon like characters with huge horns and scull like faces, and the concept of being a giant ancients god servant that uses humans as food, gunfodder ect is preaty exagarated to the level of sick. Normaly the character Khul or Kal or Kul -or King Kul was Robert Howards precursor characters for the Conan character- and this game brings that kinda wibe to a bloody pokemon" level of view. Considering gameplay the game is action based and recquires moderate use of skill in movement and use of variety of diferent momentary tactics but with using basic tehniques of combat present in the game -and especially kiting bosses to open up so you can dps them then kite again -you can speedrun relatively fast trought the game. Shame that the multiplayer part is mostly control point based and there is a lot of grind both from the cloned characters as the high level on low level fights-which can slow your progress in the game. The Miniboses are actually more chalenging than the bosses of the levels- but you can always dash around them with wall hughing method and save time. Althou the combat itself is quite stationary in a sense youre instant traped - the dash atacks and evadings become a boring method for stronger monsters -and the blocking of atacks can often leave you stagered and swarmed by creatures. (the beastery in the game is not that various or rich -the same creatures repeat to show up over and over as level feed) . The crusade feature is an intreseting concept in the game- since it leaves a clone of you at a spot to fight players when you are offline. But the conotations of canibalism and a wrecking ball barbarian allthou they seem to be put for comic effect -kinda surpass that level and become revolting since the concept is forced trough and repeatable to the level of dank monothony. The achivments in the game are quite easy to do and they pop up themselfs without trying. Yeah but the inital idea of the game is a very old concept in gaming just broth to the next level and beyond a cliff. The level of grotesque blood spiling scenes and terrifying horor enemies -over the top -and the bad multiplayer really turn me back from this game and it is why i do not recomend it
date: its true that these elements are common in these type of games but here there exagarated in a bad way. So Ascending in Hand of Kul is actually descending into numbness in RL.\n\n;-}"
